title: chore(deps): bump rxjava from 2.2.3 to 2.2.4
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [rxjava](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava) from 2.2.3 to 2.2.4.
Release notes *Sourced from [rxjava's releases](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/releases).* > ## 2.2.4 > [Maven](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Cio.reactivex.rxjava2%7Crxjava%7C2.2.4%7C) > > #### API changes > > - [Pull 6278](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6278): Add `Maybe`/`Single`/`Completable` `materialize` operator, > - [Pull 6278](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6278): Add `Single.dematerialize(selector)` operator. > - [Pull 6281](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6281): Add `Flowable`/`Observable` `dematerialize(selector)` operator. > > #### Bugfixes > > - [Pull 6258](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6258): Fix cancel/dispose upon upstream switch for some operators. > - [Pull 6269](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6269): Call the `doOn{Dispose|Cancel}` handler at most once. > - [Pull 6283](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6283): Fix `Observable.flatMap` to sustain concurrency level. > - [Pull 6297](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6297): Fix refCount eager disconnect not resetting the connection. > > #### Documentation changes > > - [Pull 6280](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6280): Improve the package docs of `io.reactivex.schedulers`. > - [Pull 6301](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6301): Add missing `onSubscribe` null-checks to NPE docs on `Flowable`/`Observable` `subscribe`. > - [Pull 6303](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6303): Fix incorrect image placement in `Flowable.zip` docs. > - [Pull 6305](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6305): Explain the non-concurrency requirement of the `Emitter` interface methods. > - [Pull 6308](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6308): Explain the need to consume both the group sequence and each group specifically with `Flowable.groupBy`. > - [Pull 6311](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6311): Explain that `distinctUntilChanged` requires non-mutating data to work as expected. > > #### Wiki changes > > - [Pull 6260](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6260): Add `generate` examples to `Creating-Observables.md`. > - [Pull 6267](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6267): Fix `Creating-Observables.md` docs stlye mistake. > - [Pull 6273](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6273): Fix broken markdown of `How-to-Contribute.md`. > - [Pull 6266](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6266): Update Error Handling Operators docs. > - [Pull 6291](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6291): Update Transforming Observables docs. > > #### Other changes > > - [Pull 6262](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6262): Use JUnit's assert format for assert messages for better IDE interoperation. > - [Pull 6263](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6263): Inline `SubscriptionHelper.isCancelled()`. > - [Pull 6275](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6275): Improve the `Observable`/`Flowable` `cache()` operators. > - [Pull 6287](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6287): Expose the Keep-Alive value of the IO `Scheduler` as System property. > - [Pull 6321](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6321): Fix `Flowable.toObservable` backpressure annotation.
Changelog *Sourced from [rxjava's changelog](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/blob/2.x/CHANGES.md).* > ### Version 2.2.4 - November 23, 2018 ([Maven](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Cio.reactivex.rxjava2%7Crxjava%7C2.2.4%7C)) > > #### API changes > > - [Pull 6278](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6278): Add `Maybe`/`Single`/`Completable` `materialize` operator, > - [Pull 6278](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6278): Add `Single.dematerialize(selector)` operator. > - [Pull 6281](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6281): Add `Flowable`/`Observable` `dematerialize(selector)` operator. > > #### Bugfixes > > - [Pull 6258](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6258): Fix cancel/dispose upon upstream switch for some operators. > - [Pull 6269](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6269): Call the `doOn{Dispose|Cancel}` handler at most once. > - [Pull 6283](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6283): Fix `Observable.flatMap` to sustain concurrency level. > - [Pull 6297](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6297): Fix refCount eager disconnect not resetting the connection. > > #### Documentation changes > > - [Pull 6280](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6280): Improve the package docs of `io.reactivex.schedulers`. > - [Pull 6301](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6301): Add missing `onSubscribe` null-checks to NPE docs on `Flowable`/`Observable` `subscribe`. > - [Pull 6303](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6303): Fix incorrect image placement in `Flowable.zip` docs. > - [Pull 6305](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6305): Explain the non-concurrency requirement of the `Emitter` interface methods. > - [Pull 6308](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6308): Explain the need to consume both the group sequence and each group specifically with `Flowable.groupBy`. > - [Pull 6311](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6311): Explain that `distinctUntilChanged` requires non-mutating data to work as expected. > > #### Wiki changes > > - [Pull 6260](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6260): Add `generate` examples to `Creating-Observables.md`. > - [Pull 6267](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6267): Fix `Creating-Observables.md` docs stlye mistake. > - [Pull 6273](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6273): Fix broken markdown of `How-to-Contribute.md`. > - [Pull 6266](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6266): Update Error Handling Operators docs. > - [Pull 6291](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6291): Update Transforming Observables docs. > > #### Other changes > > - [Pull 6262](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6262): Use JUnit's assert format for assert messages for better IDE interoperation. > - [Pull 6263](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6263): Inline `SubscriptionHelper.isCancelled()`. > - [Pull 6275](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6275): Improve the `Observable`/`Flowable` `cache()` operators. > - [Pull 6287](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6287): Expose the Keep-Alive value of the IO `Scheduler` as System property. > - [Pull 6321](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6321): Fix `Flowable.toObservable` backpressure annotation.
Commits - [`6ae765a`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/6ae765a899969682263acef757480df95b026783) Release 2.2.4 - [`3e4ae38`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/3e4ae3856f184d5783d34ffc5c468d91e67d77d8) Fix Flowable#toObservable backpressure support ([#6321](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6321)) - [`7058126`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/7058126ad4763a0ba6bcbf8433792f04426f5a77) Javadoc: explain that distinctUntilChanged requires non-mutating data to work... - [`f800b30`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/f800b30f044497ea11f23986d3d6260e7ea69f2b) Javadoc updates for RXJava Issue 6289 ([#6308](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6308)) - title: Adding a login button Events tab
body:
**Describe the feature you'd like**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
There is no specific button open login screen, only way to open it is opening tickets or profile tab.
There should be a option to login on first tab(that is events tab), probably a FAB would be the best.



**Would you like to work on the issue?**
<!-- Please let us know if you can work on it or the issue should be assigned to someone else. -->
- [x] Yes
- [ ] No

title: Opening Login screen first
body:
**Describe the feature you'd like**
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you want to happen. -->
In my opinion Login Screen should open first on first launch of the app (like most of the apps have) , user would have an option to login later .

Some member please confirm if it is right thing, I would start working on it.

**Would you like to work on the issue?**

- [ ] No

title: chore(deps): bump retrofit from 2.4.0 to 2.5.0
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [retrofit](https://github.com/square/retrofit) from 2.4.0 to 2.5.0.
Changelog *Sourced from [retrofit's changelog](https://github.com/square/retrofit/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).* > Version 2.5.0 *(2018-11-18)* > ---------------------------- > > * New: Built-in support for Kotlin's `Unit` type. This behaves the same as Java's `Void` where the body > content is ignored and immediately discarded. > * New: Built-in support for Java 8's `Optional` and `CompletableFuture` types. Previously the 'converter-java8' > and 'adapter-java8' dependencies were needed and explicitly adding `Java8OptionalConverterFactory` and/or > `Java8CallAdapterFactory` to your `Retrofit.Builder` in order to use these types. Support is now built-in and > those types and their artifacts are marked as deprecated. > * New: `Invocation` class provides a reference to the invoked method and argument list as a tag on the > underlying OkHttp `Call`. This can be accessed from an OkHttp interceptor for things like logging, analytics, > or metrics aggregation. > * New: Kotlin extension for `Retrofit` which allows you call `create` passing the interface type only as > a generic parameter (e.g., `retrofit.create()`). > * New: Added `Response.success` overload which allows specifying a custom 2xx status code. > * New: Added `Calls.failure` overload which allows passing any `Throwable` subtype. > * New: Minimal R8 rules now ship inside the jar requiring no client configuration in the common case. > * Fix: Do not propagate fatal errors to the callback. They are sent to the thread's uncaught > exception handler. > * Fix: Do not enqueue/execute an otherwise useless call when the RxJava type is disposed by `onSubscribe`. > * Fix: Call `RxJavaPlugins` assembly hook when creating an RxJava 2 type. > * Fix: Ensure both the Guava and Java 8 `Optional` converters delegate properly. This ensures that converters > registered prior to the optional converter can be used for deserializing the body type. > * Fix: Prevent `[**Path**](https://github.com/Path)` values from participating in path-traversal. This ensures untrusted input passed as > a path value cannot cause you to make a request to an un-intended relative URL. > * Fix: Simple XML converter (which is deprecated) no longer wraps subtypes of `RuntimeException` > or `IOException` when it fails. > * Fix: Prevent JAXB converter from loading remote entities and DTDs. > * Fix: Correctly detect default methods in interfaces on Android (API 24+). These still do not work, but > now a correct exception will be thrown when detected. > * Fix: Report more accurate exceptions when a `[**QueryName**](https://github.com/QueryName)` or `[**QueryMap**](https://github.com/QueryMap)` precedes a `[**Url**](https://github.com/Url)` parameter. > * Update OkHttp dependency to 3.12.

title: fix: Improve code logic to handle no connectivity better on home screen
body:
Modify code logic to handle no connectivity better on refresh by showing the no internet card instantaneously, hiding the refreshing layout and not initiating non required calls to network methods.

Fixes #691 
Changes: 

The code logic has been modified to handle the issue mentioned.
Screenshots for the change:

Before:
Refreshing the event list (one fully loaded) under no internet:
(This state remains for a long time as the connection methods are called, and finally terminates after 8-10 secs with a toast)

![screenshot_1542134680](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31897110/48495654-802c0480-e856-11e8-9095-f0c476b903f5.png)

After making the changes, and refreshing the events list (once fully loaded) under no internet:

![screenshot_1542135460](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31897110/48495683-8d48f380-e856-11e8-8234-147103d30aee.png)

title: chore(deps): bump kotlin_version from 1.3.0 to 1.3.10
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps `kotlin_version` from 1.3.0 to 1.3.10. Updates `kotlin-gradle-plugin` from 1.3.0 to 1.3.10
Release notes *Sourced from [kotlin-gradle-plugin's releases](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/releases).* > ## 1.3.10 > ## Content > The release contains the JVM version of Kotlin compiler and also one native system dependent version for every major platform (Linux, macOS, and Windows). Those binaries are built with Excelsior JET AOT compiler (https://www.excelsiorjet.com/) and have faster startup time which is suitable for building small files or scripts. > > ## Changelog > ### Compiler > > - [`KT-27758`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27758) Kotlin 1.3 breaks compilation of calling of function named 'contract' with block as a last parameter > - [`KT-27895`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27895) Kotlin 1.3.0 broken runtime annotation issue > > ### IDE > > - [`KT-27230`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27230) Freeze on paste > - [`KT-27907`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27907) Exception on processing auto-generated classes from AS > > ### IDE. Debugger > > - [`KT-27540`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27540) 2018.3 and 2019.1 Debugger: Evaluating anything fails with KNPE in LabelNormalizationMethodTransformer > - [`KT-27833`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27833) Evaluate exception in 183/191 with `asm-7.0-beta1`/'asm-7.0' > - [`KT-27965`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27965) Sequence debugger does not work in Android Studio > - [`KT-27980`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27980) Kotlin sequence debugger throws IDE exception in IDEA 183 > > ### IDE. Gradle > > - [`KT-27265`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27265) Unresolved reference in IDE on calling JVM source set members of a multiplatform project with Android target from a plain Kotlin/JVM module > - [`KT-27849`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27849) IntelliJ: Wrong scope of JVM platform MPP dependency > > ### IDE. Inspections and Intentions > > - [`KT-26481`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-26481) Flaky false positive "Receiver parameter is never used" for local extension function > - [`KT-27357`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27357) Function with inline class type value parameters is marked as unused by IDE > - [`KT-27434`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27434) False positive "Unused symbol" inspection for functions and secondary constructors of inline classes > - [`KT-27945`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27945) Quick-fix whitespace bug in KtPrimaryConstructor.addAnnotationEntry() > > ### IDE. Scratch > > - [`KT-27746`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27746) Scratch: "Cannot pop operand off an empty stack" in a new scratch file > > ### IDE. Tests Support > > - [`KT-27371`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27371) Common tests can not be launched from gutter in MPP Android/iOS project > > ### Reflection > > - [`KT-27878`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27878) Spring: "AssertionError: Non-primitive type name passed: void" > > ### Tools. Gradle > > - [`KT-27160`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27160) Kotlin Gradle plugin 1.3 resolves script configurations during project evaluation > - [`KT-27803`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-27803) CInterop input configuration has 'java-api' as a Usage attribute value in new MPP > ... (truncated)
Changelog *Sourced from [kotlin-gradle-plugin's changelog](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/blob/master/ChangeLog.md).* > # CHANGELOG
Commits - [`72e2bbd`](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commit/72e2bbd2e02b2178379ec78d09a3d12fb8bbd8d9) JS: report inline suspend functions to IC - [`5f61ecd`](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commit/5f61ecdd8da52d248df1c764179cf3a6cb58917c) Fix dependency resolution on model post-processing - [`58046ae`](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commit/58046aead2813cbe0e178c2d82dac6795246012f) MPP: Support MPP-dependent Java modules in Android projects - [`615d801`](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commit/615d801bc98c0d279b0bbc3d24ba424330590894) Fix NPE in KotlinJavaMPPSourceSetDataService.postProcess - [`17010d9`](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commit/17010d98beb8d07c8ef35a7d15600c2e464bd5a1) Do not try computing return type in OverloadChecker - [`e4e1dbf`](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commit/e4e1dbfd96448a232a5e1c0ced1411d82e5ccc5e) Kapt: Use correct type mapping mode while mapping super types (KT-27126) - [`6f6a30d`](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commit/6f6a30dfc8c9e3c5ee1ba9dbf19ac068791660c2) Kapt: Fix error type correction for super class constructor calls - [`0132c53`](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commit/0132c53055e0eeecdc2effc265e7bbfba6410b9f) Update Kotlin/Native: 1.0.2 - [`37dfa24`](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commit/37dfa2498db5d2bbca656714f72ba47902a422d5) JPS: support -Xcommon-sources for JVM multiplatform projects - [`97682e8`](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commit/97682e8e01ad848ae7897c97c96cc5023b08b246) JS: fix concurrent access to NameSuggestion.cache (KT-27230 fixed) - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/compare/v1.3.0...v1.3.10)

title: fix: Fix the no connectivity case bug on Main Activity
body:
Improve logic of code to handle no connectivity better on refresh by showing the no internet card instantaneously, hide the refreshing layout, and not initiating non-required calls to network methods.

Fixes #691 
Changes: 

The code logic has been modified to handle the issue mentioned.

Screenshots for the change:
Before:
Refreshing the event list (one fully loaded) under no internet:
(This state remains for a long time as the connection methods are called, and finally terminates after 8-10 secs with a toast)

![screenshot_1542134680](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31897110/48436691-5f57a680-e7a5-11e8-9dff-f1c14010b63e.png)

After making the changes, and refreshing the events list (once fully loaded) under no internet:

![screenshot_1542135460](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31897110/48436650-3f27e780-e7a5-11e8-9bf3-6c21124520c4.png)

title: No internet case not handled properly in the main activity
body:
**Description**

Once the events on the main screen have been loaded, if the internet connection is lost, and the user refreshes the list, the code makes the request to the server, hence the SwipeRefreshLayout keeps refreshing for a while (about 8-10 secs), after which a toast appears: "Error fetching events"

**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to main activity with the internet connection working, let it load all events.
2. Turn on flight mode.
3. Refresh the events list.


**Expected behavior**

The no internet card should appear instantaneously, the app should not initiate call to the server (via retryLoadLocationEvents() method), and the swipe refresh layout should stop refreshing.


**Screenshots**

![screenshot_1542134680](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31897110/48435599-e9524000-e7a2-11e8-8179-911af25d1a88.png)

**Would you like to work on the issue?**
Yes, working on it.

title: fix: improve logic of onBackPressed for Fragments
improve on back pressed logic to remove bugs
body:
**Describe the bug**
- Last fragment is set on back pressed in event fragment
- Event fragment directly set from settings fragment

**To Reproduce**
1. One search/favorite/profile fragment
2. Press back again after the event fragment
3. Last fragment is set
4. Open settings fragment
5. Events are open instead of open profile fragment

**Expected behavior**
- All main fragment should set event fragment on back pressed
- Settings fragment should set profile fragment on back pressed

**Smartphone Info:**
|Device         |Mi Max 2|
|Android Version| Nougat 7.1    |

**Additional context**
![blank diagram 3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/27783786/48119322-f77cf980-e294-11e8-951d-539b360bf681.jpeg)

title: fix : App crash while trying to editing a profile with no profile picture
body:
Fixes #683 

Changes: Added code to check if the profile picture URL is not empty, as Picasso requires a non-empty url. Thus if there is no profile picture initially, there should be no attempt to load such an image.

title: APP CRASH : Edit Profile is crashing the app
body:
After logging in and navigating to the profile section, clicking on Edit Profile from the menu bar, the app crashes.
EDIT : Only happens with profiles with no profile picture. A user having a profile picture will face no issue

**To Reproduce**
1. Login / Sign Up 
2. Navigate to Profile Tab
3. Open Menu Bar (3 Dots)
4. Choose Edit Profile

**Expected behavior**
Edit Profile fragment must open up normally

title: "Search text comes once in fragment"
body:
Fixes #663

Changes: 
Made searchView occupy the whole ActionBar.

Screenshots for the change:
![search_issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34534870/47678141-102b4680-dbe7-11e8-8f22-4db08f7ead6b.gif)

title: After Clicking on event in favourites tab, we cannot go back
body:
**Describe the bug**
When we try to view an even from the favourites tab we cannot go back. The app gets stuck on the same screen with only the action bar title 

**To Reproduce**
1. Make any event your favourite.
2. Go to the favourites tab .
3. Click on the event from the favourites tab.


**Expected behavior**
When we press back , it should go back to the favourite events.

**Screenshots**
![favoutie_bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12930158/47642690-4c32bd00-db8f-11e8-8a73-dc32069f2d80.gif)

**Smartphone Info:**
| Device | Nexus 5 |
| Android Version | API 28 |

**Would you like to work on the issue?**
- [ ✓] Yes
- [ ] No
- Other:

title: Doubling tapping the share button the events screen opens share pop up twice.
label: [Label(name="invalid"), Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
**Describe the bug**
Doubling tapping the share button the events screen opens share pop up twice.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the events screen
2. Go to location singapore
3. click on the share button twice on any of the card
4. You will see  that the share pop up comes twice (when u hit the back button)

**Expected behavior**
the share pop up should only come once and the user should not be able to click it twice

**Screenshots**
<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

![shareproblemgif](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41572056/47641169-5e126100-db8b-11e8-9796-16451eee1086.gif)

**Would you like to work on the issue?**
<!-- Please let us know if you can work on it or the issue should be assigned to someone else. -->
Yes

title: fix : align progress bar in signup fragment
body:
Fixes #647

title: chore: Switch to Gradle 3.2.1 and support for build tools v28 to travis
body:
This is a fix for unsupported gradle version error in Android Studio. Switching to Gradle v3.2.1 resolves this error, but causes the Travis CI builds to fail because the current travis.yml file does not allow support for build tools v28. Therefore, travis.yml file has also been modified to accept build tools v28.

Fixes #659 

Changes: 
1. Project level build.gradle file to use Gradle v3.2.1
2. .travis.yml file to allow build tools v28.

title: Add support for Build Tool v28 and Gradle 3.2.1 to travis.yml file
body:
**Describe the chore**
The latest version of Android studio is incompatible with the Gradle version used in this project (gradle:3.2.0-alpha16). Whenever the project is imported into Android Studio, the developers are presented with this error:

![Error Screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24315306/47568711-7433dd80-d94f-11e8-8bbe-84d71faf4394.png)

If the developer updates the Gradle version to 3.2.1 and creates commits to this repository, the Travis CI builds for those commit fail with the following error:

```
FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.
* What went wrong:
A problem occurred configuring project ':app'.
> Failed to install the following Android SDK packages as some licences have not been accepted.
     build-tools;28.0.3 Android SDK Build-Tools 28.0.3
  To build this project, accept the SDK license agreements and install the missing components using the Android Studio SDK Manager.
  Alternatively, to transfer the license agreements from one workstation to another, see http://d.android.com/r/studio-ui/export-licenses.html
```

This error occurs because the current travis.yml file doesn't have support for build tools v28.


**Would you like to work on the issue?**
- [x] Yes

title: Only generate apks for merged branch
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
The apks for master and development branch currently get generated on each merged PR of the dev branch. 

Expected: The APKs for master branch should only be updated (overwritten) once master branch is updated. The development branch APKs should be updated when the dev branch is updated.

body:
Bumps [rxjava](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava) from 2.2.2 to 2.2.3.
Release notes *Sourced from [rxjava's releases](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/releases).* > ## 2.2.3 > [Maven](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Cio.reactivex.rxjava2%7Crxjava%7C2.2.3%7C) > > #### API changes > > - [Pull 6242](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6242): Add timed `Completable.delaySubscription()` operator. > > #### Documentation changes > > - [Pull 6220](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6220): Remove unnecessary 's' from `ConnectableObservable`. > - [Pull 6241](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6241): Remove mention of `io.reactivex.functions.Functions` nonexistent utility class. > > #### Other changes > > - [Pull 6232](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6232): Cleanup `Observable.flatMap` drain logic. > - [Pull 6234](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6234): Add timeout and unit to `TimeoutException` message in the `timeout` operators. > - [Pull 6236](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6236): Adjust `UndeliverableException` and `OnErrorNotImplementedException` message to use the full inner exception. > - [Pull 6244](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6244): Add `[**Nullable**](https://github.com/Nullable)` annotations for blocking methods in `Completable`.
Changelog *Sourced from [rxjava's changelog](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/blob/2.x/CHANGES.md).* > ### Version 2.2.3 - October 23, 2018 ([Maven](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Cio.reactivex.rxjava2%7Crxjava%7C2.2.3%7C)) > > #### API changes > > - [Pull 6242](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6242): Add timed `Completable.delaySubscription()` operator. > > #### Documentation changes > > - [Pull 6220](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6220): Remove unnecessary 's' from `ConnectableObservable`. > - [Pull 6241](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6241): Remove mention of `io.reactivex.functions.Functions` nonexistent utility class. > > #### Other changes > > - [Pull 6232](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6232): Cleanup `Observable.flatMap` drain logic. > - [Pull 6234](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6234): Add timeout and unit to `TimeoutException` message in the `timeout` operators. > - [Pull 6236](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6236): Adjust `UndeliverableException` and `OnErrorNotImplementedException` message to use the full inner exception. > - [Pull 6244](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6244): Add `[**Nullable**](https://github.com/Nullable)` annotations for blocking methods in `Completable`.

build(deps): bump kotlin_version from 1.2.70 to 1.2.71
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps `kotlin_version` from 1.2.70 to 1.2.71. Updates `kotlin-gradle-plugin` from 1.2.70 to 1.2.71
Release notes *Sourced from [kotlin-gradle-plugin's releases](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/releases).* > ## 1.2.71 > ### Compiler > > - [`KT-26806`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-26806) Defining constants using kotlin.math is broken in 1.2.70 > > ### IDE > > - [`KT-26399`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-26399) Kotlin Migration: NPE at KotlinMigrationProjectComponent$onImportFinished$1.run() > - [`KT-26794`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-26794) Bad version detection during migration in Android Studio 3.2 > - [`KT-26823`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-26823) Fix deadlock in databinding with AndroidX which led to Android Studio hanging > - [`KT-26889`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-26889) Don't show migration dialog if no actual migrations are available > - [`KT-25177`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25177) Report asDynamic on dynamic type as a warning > - [`KT-25454`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25454) Extract function: make default visibility private > > ### JavaScript > > - [`KT-26466`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-26466) Uncaught ReferenceError: println is not defined > > ### Tools. [`KT-25745`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25745) Do not report warning about annotations on non-existing accessors for JvmStatic properties > - [`KT-25746`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25746) Improve message for warning about annotations that have target to non-existing accessors > - [`KT-25297`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25297) Inconsistency in `KotlinULambdaExpression` and `KotlinLocalFunctionULambdaExpression` > - [`KT-25515`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25515) Add/remove analysis-related compiler setting does not update IDE project model immediately > - title: build(deps): bump preference-v7 from 27.1.1.2 to 28.0.0.0
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [preference-v7](https://github.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix) from 27.1.1.2 to 28.0.0.0.
Release notes *Sourced from [preference-v7's releases](https://github.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/releases).* > ## v28.0.0.0 > New version: 28.0.0.0 (based on v28.0.0) > > - No support preferences related changes in the support library. > - Fixed issues [#174](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/174) and [#175](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/175) > > ## v28.0.0.0-alpha3 > New version: 28.0.0.0-alpha3 (based on v28.0.0-alpha3) > > - No support preferences related changes in the support library. > - `PreferenceFragmentCompatDividers` is now deprecated. Use `PreferenceFragmentCompat` instead. > - Added `preference-v7-material` module which provides `Theme.MaterialComponents` related themes. > - Bug fixes [#166](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/166), [#169](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/169), [#173](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/173)
Changelog *Sourced from [preference-v7's changelog](https://github.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md).* > # Changelog > > **2018-09-24** > > New version: 28.0.0.0 (based on v28.0.0) > > - No support preferences related changes in the support library. > - Fixed issues [#174](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/174) and [#175](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/175) > > **2018-09-13** > > New version: 28.0.0.0-rc02 (based on v28.0.0-rc02) > > - No support preferences related changes in the support library. > > **2018-09-13** > > New version: 28.0.0.0-rc01 (based on v28.0.0-rc01) > > - Official lib bug fixes > - `PreferenceThemeOverlay` has been updated to the latest material theme. If no custom theme is provided, `PreferenceThemeOverlay` is used as the default theme. > - `PreferenceThemeOverlay.v14` and `PreferenceThemeOverlay.v14.Material` themes have been deprecated in favour of `PreferenceThemeOverlay`. > - `PreferenceGroup` visibility is now tied to its children - hiding a parent group will also prevent its children from being shown in the hierarchy. Use `Preference.isShown()` to get whether a `Preference` is actually displayed to the user in the hierarchy. > - `Preference.onSetInitialValue(boolean, Object)` has been deprecated and replaced with `onSetInitialValue(Object)`. PreferenceDataStore now also correctly restores default values. > - added `onSetInitialValue(Object)` implementation and removed the deprecated `onSetInitialValue(boolean, Object)` > > **2018-07-18** > > New version: 28.0.0.0-alpha3 (based on v28.0.0-alpha3) > > - No support preferences related changes in the support library. > - `PreferenceFragmentCompatDividers` is now deprecated. Use `PreferenceFragmentCompat` instead. > - Added `preference-v7-material` module which provides `Theme.MaterialComponents` related themes. > - Bug fixes [#166](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/166), [#169](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/169), [#173](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/173) > > **2018-07-04** > > New version: 27.1.1.2 (based on v27.1.1) > > - No support preferences related changes in the support library. > - RingtonePreference bug fixes([#164](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/164), [#165](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/165), [#167](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/167)). > > **2018-05-11** > > New version: 27.1.1.1 (based on v27.1.1) > > - No support preferences related changes in the support library. > - Bug fixes ([#153](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/153), [#149](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/149), [#155](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/155), [#152](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/issues/152)). > > **2018-04-10** > ... (truncated)
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/Gericop/Android-Support-Preference-V7-Fix/commits/v28.0.0.0)

title: Load user details in Edit Profile section
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
When user open edit profile section and update profile picture, two Toast messages are display -
1. Please provide first name and last name
2. Image uploaded successfully
**While user first name and last name already registered on the server.**

Here progress bar is also hiding by soft keyboard.

title: fix: Hide soft keyboard when LOGIN button is pressed
Keyboard is hiding Progress bar when login button is pressed.
body: In login fragment when login button is pressed, Progress bar visible but keyboard is hiding the progress bar.

build(deps): bump kotlin_version from 1.2.61 to 1.2.70
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps `kotlin_version` from 1.2.61 to 1.2.70. Updates `kotlin-gradle-plugin` from 1.2.61 to 1.2.70
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commits)

Updates `kotlin-stdlib-jdk7` from $kotlin_version to 1.2.70
Changelog *Sourced from [kotlin-stdlib-jdk7's changelog](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/blob/master/ChangeLog.md).* > # CHANGELOG > > ## 1.3-M2 > > ### Compiler > > #### New Features > > - [`KT-6592`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-6592) Support local variable initialization in lambda arguments to some functions > - [`KT-19323`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-19323) Allow generic type parameter to have mixed constraints for [**InlineOnly**](https://github.com/InlineOnly) functions > - [`KT-24857`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24857) Support compatibility wrappers for coroutines in compiler > - [`KT-25320`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25320) Support limited conversions for constants to simplify interop for Kotlin/Native > - [`KT-25372`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25372) Support JvmName on annotation property getters > - [`KT-25495`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25495) Release contract DSL as experimental > - [`KT-25557`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25557) Metadata that maps coroutine label to the file name and line number > - [`KT-25559`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25559) Metadata that maps coroutine spilled state to local variables > - [`KT-25655`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25655) Safe or non-null calls required on x following check(x != null) > - [`KT-25972`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25972) Support reading binary metadata of the next major release > > #### Performance Improvements > > - [`KT-24657`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24657) Compiler performance issues with big files > - [`KT-26243`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-26243) Avoid redundant "specialized" method for suspend lambdas. > > #### Fixes > > - [`KT-19628`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-19628) Unresolved reference not reported on data class constructor `[**get**](https://github.com/get)` annotation > - [`KT-20830`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20830) Nulls can propagate through "enhanced nullability" types on module boundaries > - [`KT-21240`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-21240) Remove suspendCoroutineOrReturn intrinsic from compiler > - [`KT-22379`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22379) Condition of while-loop with break can produce unsound smartcast > - [`KT-23438`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23438) Back-end (JVM) Internal error: Failed to generate function suspendCoroutineOrReturn > - [`KT-23819`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23819) Inline classes: mapping of fully generic classes > - [`KT-23857`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23857) Annotation with target TYPE is not applicable to TYPE_USE in Java sources > - [`KT-24717`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24717) Allow number literals to be used as unsigned ones with unsigned expected typed > - [`KT-24860`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24860) Forbid usage function expression as suspend function expression > - [`KT-24872`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24872) Do not generate user-defined methods inside box class of inline class > - [`KT-24873`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24873) Generate equals/hashCode/toString methods for inline classes same as for data classes > - [`KT-25246`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25246) Incorrect bytecode generated for secondary constructor in inline class + primitive array > - [`KT-25278`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25278) No smart cast for "returns() implies" contract when default argument is omitted > - [`KT-25287`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25287) Getter-targeted annotations on annotation constructor parameters are lost > - [`KT-25293`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25293) “Couldn't transform method node” error on compiling inline class with hashCode() method call when underlying value type is basic (number, char, boolean) > - [`KT-25299`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25299) NoSuchMethodError Foo$Erased.hashCode(Ljava/lang/Object;) for hashCode(), toString() and equals() methods in inline classes > - [`KT-25328`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25328) “Couldn't transform method node” error on compiling inline class which is wrapping Unit type > - [`KT-25330`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25330) CCE “[Ljava.lang.Integer; cannot be cast to Foo” for inline class which is wrapping Array > - [`KT-25521`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25521) Coroutines state machine in Kotlin 1.3 should not have getLabel/setLabel > - [`KT-25558`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25558) Stabilize field naming and mangling for suspending lambda classes > - [`KT-25580`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25580) No warning about experimental API when unsigned types are inferred > - [`KT-25599`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25599) “Exception during code generation” on compiling code with public constructor of unsigned numbers array > - [`KT-25614`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25614) Support secondary constructors for inline classes > - [`KT-25683`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25683) Compiler support for calling experimental suspend functions and function with experimental suspend function type as parameter > ... (truncated)
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commits)

title: build(deps): bump rxjava from 2.2.1 to 2.2.2
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [rxjava](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava) from 2.2.1 to 2.2.2.
Release notes *Sourced from [rxjava's releases](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/releases).* > ## 2.2.2 > [Maven](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Cio.reactivex.rxjava2%7Crxjava%7C2.2.2%7C) > > #### Bugfixes > > - [Pull 6187](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6187): Fix `refCount` termination-reconnect race. > > #### Documentation changes > > - [Pull 6171](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6171): Add explanation text to `Undeliverable` & `OnErrorNotImplemented` exceptions. > - [Pull 6174](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6174): Auto-clean up RxJavaPlugins JavaDocs HTML. > - [Pull 6175](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6175): Explain `null` observer/subscriber return errors from `RxJavaPlugins` in detail. > - [Pull 6180](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6180): Update `Additional-Reading.md`. > - [Pull 6180](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6180): Fix `Flowable.reduce(BiFunction)` JavaDoc; the operator does not signal `NoSuchElementException`. > - [Pull 6193](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6193): Add "error handling" java docs section to `fromCallable` & co. > - [Pull 6199](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6199): Fix terminology of cancel/dispose in the JavaDocs. > - [Pull 6200](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6200): Fix `toFuture` marbles and descriptions.
Changelog *Sourced from [rxjava's changelog](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/blob/2.x/CHANGES.md).* > ### Version 2.2.2 - September 6, 2018 ([Maven](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Cio.reactivex.rxjava2%7Crxjava%7C2.2.2%7C)) > > #### Bugfixes > > - [Pull 6187](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6187): Fix `refCount` termination-reconnect race. > > #### Documentation changes > > - [Pull 6171](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6171): Add explanation text to `Undeliverable` & `OnErrorNotImplemented` exceptions. > - [Pull 6174](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6174): Auto-clean up RxJavaPlugins JavaDocs HTML. > - [Pull 6175](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6175): Explain `null` observer/subscriber return errors from `RxJavaPlugins` in detail. > - [Pull 6180](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6180): Update `Additional-Reading.md`. > - [Pull 6180](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6180): Fix `Flowable.reduce(BiFunction)` JavaDoc; the operator does not signal `NoSuchElementException`. > - [Pull 6193](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6193): Add "error handling" java docs section to `fromCallable` & co. > - [Pull 6199](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6199): Fix terminology of cancel/dispose in the JavaDocs. > - [Pull 6200](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6200): Fix `toFuture` marbles and descriptions.
Commits - [`cc45975`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/cc459751031f6122330c08dcc2e57c9b5370cee3) Release 2.2.2 - [`59454ea`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/59454ea47965547e7e218039ed152b591a51e268) Fix terminology of cancel/dispose in the JavaDocs ([#6199](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6199)) - [`fbbae6c`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/fbbae6c37bca0a22e32aad6f2901cf65fc460d8a) 2.x: Fix toFlowable marbles and descriptions ([#6200](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6200)) - [`e0532b7`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/e0532b71f7eb6e2973b8c9b155b53a671caa0e9f) Add "error handling" java docs section to from callable & co ([#6193](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6193)) - [`205fea6`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/205fea69982f5f0f2eb7f1b767e864c0d3901a71) [#6195](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6195) Fix Flowable.reduce(BiFunction) JavaDoc ([#6197](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6197)) - [`c7d91c6`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/c7d91c68ef8011f9d753111a8c839297850aeb66) 2.x: Fix refCount termination-reconnect race ([#6187](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6187)) - [`2e566fb`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/2e566fbc34e47de59cf76d862e5bfb631e36215c) 2.x: Cleanup multiple empty lines in sources ([#6182](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6182)) - [`13f7b01`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/13f7b01f4e681a6aa7494cdae5f2cf4474b2baab) Update Additional-Reading.md ([#6180](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6180)) - [`e2a2159`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/e2a21599fa451ff26f00ec52133604e8daf7d78c) 2.x: explain null observer/subscriber return errors from RxJavaPlugins in det... - [`ba7bbb4`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/ba7bbb497d43a1353a3e5f81b0887b26bf4cadfb) Auto-clean up RxJavaPlugins JavaDocs HTML ([#6173](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6173)) ([#6174](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6174)) - title: build(deps): bump mockk from 1.8.6 to 1.8.7
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [mockk](https://github.com/mockk/mockk) from 1.8.6 to 1.8.7.
Release notes *Sourced from [mockk's releases](https://github.com/mockk/mockk/releases).* > ## MockK v1.8.7 > - [#123](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/mockk/mockk/issues/123) ConcurrentModificationException on parallel tests > - [#126](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/mockk/mockk/issues/126) Spring MockMvc fails to perform requests on spyk controllers > - [#129](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/mockk/mockk/issues/129) After invoking mockk; the mocked ::class.java constructor is overriden in the JVM > - [#120](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/mockk/mockk/issues/120) Mocking an interface from a signed dependency fails.
Commits - [`2ecd4c4`](https://github.com/mockk/mockk/commit/2ecd4c4f1d1ee2ddb8e501fc910ec3501a434914) Version 1.8.8-SNAPSHOT - [`d7a235d`](https://github.com/mockk/mockk/commit/d7a235dda524b80168a802842064e52b74b5b3d2) Version 1.8.7 - [`8290b3a`](https://github.com/mockk/mockk/commit/8290b3a7854a5a9ae952c44490dfac774b486a62) Adding possibility to dump classes via system property [#119](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/mockk/mockk/issues/119) - [`f9f8ef4`](https://github.com/mockk/mockk/commit/f9f8ef4870c31b714d8cde2d750112e5140b7693) Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' - [`c6e6d4e`](https://github.com/mockk/mockk/commit/c6e6d4ecf81706740c2dc38f21c28970f3ce223e) Fixing [#120](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/mockk/mockk/issues/120) - [`ba79c03`](https://github.com/mockk/mockk/commit/ba79c03c957b2c1939dc8ae5a2408d226524ff12) Update issue_template.md - [`2a19b51`](https://github.com/mockk/mockk/commit/2a19b516be2df2b0abf0d61f51d19ea66f191e04) Fixing [#129](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/mockk/mockk/issues/129) - [`6aa4827`](https://github.com/mockk/mockk/commit/6aa4827b63adcfe41a488c847206a875d44cbe6b) Fix [#123](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/mockk/mockk/issues/123) - [`00bc796`](https://github.com/mockk/mockk/commit/00bc796621292ade491daa7fc9f2d688fb0b0e0b) Copy annotations from original class during bytebuddy proxy ([#127](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/mockk/mockk/issues/127)) - [`c5fcf11`](https://github.com/mockk/mockk/commit/c5fcf116f19de745870f02b3614d7f779a412f0d) Update README.md - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/mockk/mockk/compare/1.8.6...1.8.7)

title: build(deps): bump rxjava from 2.2.0 to 2.2.1
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [rxjava](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava) from 2.2.0 to 2.2.1.
Release notes *Sourced from [rxjava's releases](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/releases).* > ## 2.2.1 > [Maven](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Cio.reactivex.rxjava2%7Crxjava%7C2.2.1%7C) > > #### API changes > > - [Pull 6143](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6143): Add `concatArrayEagerDelayError` operator (expose feature). > > #### Bugfixes > > - [Pull 6145](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6145): Fix boundary fusion of `concatMap` and `publish` operator. > - [Pull 6158](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6158): Make `Flowable.fromCallable` consistent with the other `fromCallable`s. > - [Pull 6165](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6165): Handle undeliverable error in `Completable.fromCallable` via `RxJavaPlugins`. > - [Pull 6167](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6167): Make `observeOn` not let `worker.dispose()` get called prematurely. > > #### Performance improvements > > - [Pull 6123](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6123): Improve `Completable.onErrorResumeNext` internals. > - [Pull 6121](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6121): `Flowable.onErrorResumeNext` improvements. > > #### Documentation changes > > ##### JavaDocs > > - [Pull 6095](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6095): Add marbles for `Single.timer`, `Single.defer` and `Single.toXXX` operators. > - [Pull 6137](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6137): Add marbles for `Single.concat` operator. > - [Pull 6141](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6141): Add marble diagrams for various `Single` operators. > - [Pull 6152](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6152): Clarify `TestObserver.assertValueSet` in docs and via tests. > - [Pull 6155](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6155): Fix marble of `Maybe.flatMap` events to `MaybeSource`. > > ##### Wiki changes > > - [Pull 6128](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6128): Remove `fromEmitter()` in wiki. > - [Pull 6133](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6133): Update `_Sidebar.md` with new order of topics. > - [Pull 6135](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6135): Initial clean up for Combining Observables docs. > - [Pull 6131](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6131): Expand `Creating-Observables.md` wiki. > - [Pull 6134](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6134): Update RxJava Android Module documentation. > - [Pull 6140](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6140): Update Mathematical and Aggregate Operators docs.
Changelog *Sourced from [rxjava's changelog](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/blob/2.x/CHANGES.md).* > ### Version 2.2.1 - August 23, 2018 ([Maven](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Cio.reactivex.rxjava2%7Crxjava%7C2.2.1%7C)) > > #### API changes > > - [Pull 6143](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6143): Add `concatArrayEagerDelayError` operator (expose feature). > > #### Bugfixes > > - [Pull 6145](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6145): Fix boundary fusion of `concatMap` and `publish` operator. > - [Pull 6158](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6158): Make `Flowable.fromCallable` consistent with the other `fromCallable`s. > - [Pull 6165](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6165): Handle undeliverable error in `Completable.fromCallable` via `RxJavaPlugins`. > - [Pull 6167](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6167): Make `observeOn` not let `worker.dispose()` get called prematurely. > > #### Performance improvements > > - [Pull 6123](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6123): Improve `Completable.onErrorResumeNext` internals. > - [Pull 6121](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6121): `Flowable.onErrorResumeNext` improvements. > > #### Documentation changes > > ##### JavaDocs > > - [Pull 6095](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6095): Add marbles for `Single.timer`, `Single.defer` and `Single.toXXX` operators. > - [Pull 6137](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6137): Add marbles for `Single.concat` operator. > - [Pull 6141](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6141): Add marble diagrams for various `Single` operators. > - [Pull 6152](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6152): Clarify `TestObserver.assertValueSet` in docs and via tests. > - [Pull 6155](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6155): Fix marble of `Maybe.flatMap` events to `MaybeSource`. > > ##### Wiki changes > > - [Pull 6128](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6128): Remove `fromEmitter()` in wiki. > - [Pull 6133](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6133): Update `_Sidebar.md` with new order of topics. > - [Pull 6135](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6135): Initial clean up for Combining Observables docs. > - [Pull 6131](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6131): Expand `Creating-Observables.md` wiki. > - [Pull 6134](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6134): Update RxJava Android Module documentation. > - [Pull 6140](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6140): Update Mathematical and Aggregate Operators docs. >
Commits - [`5445b4a`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/5445b4a18088a14185eb4bd7f2f7556a48698755) Release 2.2.1 - [`eceae80`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/eceae80aedfb942c82f66890c4c7c7e2bcf80d8a) Remove unused imports - [`ab64982`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/ab649824e6d55505cc7b3e6d9fb033143146b110) 2.x: Make observeOn not let worker.dispose() called prematurely ([#6167](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6167)) - [`5c67fe4`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/5c67fe4ec72f41256874fc1ecd4faf2b92d1899f) Update `unsubscribeOn` tests to avoid the termination-cancel race - [`592b991`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/592b991dd8d148351fe4d52de6e8512f274285de) Error handle on Completable.fromCallable with RxJavaPlugins ([#6165](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6165)) - [`7d65291`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/7d652913772abcdbb429d5b132b830462661ee23) 2.x: Make Flowable.fromCallable consitent with the other fromCallables ([#6158](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6158)) - [`835ab00`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/commit/835ab00699d39c092ef6e90cf1868722b9180fe1) 2.x: Fix marble of Maybe.flatMap events to MaybeSource ([#6155](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues/6155)) - title: Scroll not working
body:
Scroll not working on Home screen (Main activity) while returning from Discount Codes(DiscountCodesFragment) without login. 

### why?
This issue is due to DiscountCodesFragement because while returning from login activity the fragment is not properly finished.

### Solution
Give an Intent to MainActivity while returning from LoginActivity.

body:
Bumps `kotlin_version` from 1.2.60 to 1.2.61. Updates `kotlin-gradle-plugin` from 1.2.60 to 1.2.61
Release notes *Sourced from [kotlin-gradle-plugin's releases](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/releases).* > ## Kotlin 1.2.60 RC2 > ### Compiler > > - [`KT-22517`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22517) Deprecate smartcasts for local delegated properties > - [`KT-24911`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24911) Kotlin 1.2.50: UI for [**RecentlyNonNull**](https://github.com/RecentlyNonNull) looks strange in the editor > - [`KT-25333`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25333) Restrict visibility of Java static members from supertypes of companion object > > ### IDE > > - [`KT-15300`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-15300) "INFO - project.TargetPlatformDetector - Using default platform" flood in log > - [`KT-24979`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24979) IndexNotReadyException in KtLightClassForSourceDeclaration#isInheritor > - [`KT-25242`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25242) 'Resolved to error element' highlighting is confusingly similar to an active live template > - [`KT-25414`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25414) Support checking eap-1.3 channel for updates > - [`KT-25524`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25524) UAST: proper resolve for function variable call > > ### IDE. Android > > - [`KT-17946`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-17946) Android Studio: remove Gradle configurator on configuring Kotlin > > ### IDE. Refactorings > > - [`KT-23983`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23983) Extract function: Reified type parameters are not extracted properly > > ### IDE. Script > > - [`KT-25373`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25373) Deadlock in idea plugin > > ### Language design > > - [`KT-13762`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-13762) Prohibit annotations with target 'EXPRESSION' and retention 'BINARY' or 'RUNTIME' > > ### Libraries > > - [`KT-25351`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25351) `TestNGAsserter` needs to swap expected/actual > > ### Tools. Android Extensions > > - [`KT-22576`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22576) Parcelable: Allow Parcelize to work with object and enum types > - [`KT-24459`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24459) [**IgnoredOnParcel**](https://github.com/IgnoredOnParcel) annotation doesn't work for [**Parcelize**](https://github.com/Parcelize) > - [`KT-24720`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24720) Parcelable: java.lang.LinkageError > > ### Tools. Compiler Plugins > > - [`KT-23808`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23808) Array in [**Parcelize**](https://github.com/Parcelize) class generates an java.lang.VerifyError > > ### Tools. JPS > > - [`KT-22611`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22611) Support compiling scripts in JPS > > ### Tools. kapt > ... (truncated)
Changelog *Sourced from [kotlin-gradle-plugin's changelog](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/blob/master/ChangeLog.md).* > # CHANGELOG
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commits)

Updates `kotlin-stdlib-jdk7` from $kotlin_version to 1.2.61
Changelog *Sourced from [kotlin-stdlib-jdk7's changelog](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/blob/master/ChangeLog.md).* > # CHANGELOG > > ## 1.2.60 > > ### Compiler > > - [`KT-13762`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-13762) Prohibit annotations with target 'EXPRESSION' and retention 'BINARY' or 'RUNTIME' > - [`KT-18882`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-18882) Allow code to have platform specific annotations when compiled for different platforms > - [`KT-20356`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20356) Internal compiler error - This method shouldn't be invoked for INVISIBLE_FAKE visibility > - [`KT-22517`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22517) Deprecate smartcasts for local delegated properties > - [`KT-23153`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23153) Compiler allows to set non constant value as annotation parameter > - [`KT-23413`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23413) IndexOutOfBoundsException on local delegated properties from `provideDelegate` if there's at least one non-local delegated property > - [`KT-23742`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23742) Optimise inline class redundant boxing on return from inlined lambda > - [`KT-24513`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24513) High memory usage in Kotlin and 2018.1 > - [`KT-24617`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24617) Optional expected annotation is unresolved in a dependent platform module > - [`KT-24679`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24679) KotlinUCallExpression doesn't resolve callee if it is an inline method > - [`KT-24808`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24808) NI: nested `withContext` call is reported with `Suspension functions can be called only within coroutine body` error > - [`KT-24825`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24825) NoClassDefFoundError on SAM adapter in a nested call in inlined lambda since 1.2.40 > - [`KT-24859`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24859) Disallow calls of functions annotated with receiver annotated with [**RestrictsSuspension**](https://github.com/RestrictsSuspension) in foreign suspension context > - [`KT-24911`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24911) Kotlin 1.2.50: UI for [**RecentlyNonNull**](https://github.com/RecentlyNonNull) looks strange in the editor > - [`KT-25333`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25333) Restrict visibility of Java static members from supertypes of companion object > > ### IDE > > #### Performance Improvements > > - [`KT-20924`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20924) Slow KtLightAbstractAnnotation.getClsDelegate() lightAnnotations.kt > - [`KT-23844`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23844) Kotlin property accessor searcher consumes CPU when invoked on a scope consisting only of Java files > > #### Fixes > > - [`KT-4311`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-4311) "Override members" works wrong when function is extension > - [`KT-13948`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-13948) IDE plugins: improve description > - [`KT-15300`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-15300) "INFO - project.TargetPlatformDetector - Using default platform" flood in log > - [`KT-17350`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-17350) Implement members from interface fails when one of the generic types is unresolved > - [`KT-17668`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-17668) Edit Configuration dialog doesn't have a button for choosing the "Main class" field > - [`KT-19102`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-19102) Wrong equals() and hashCode() code generated for arrays of arrays > - [`KT-20056`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20056) TCE on creating object of an anonymous class in Kotlin script > - [`KT-21863`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-21863) Imported typealias to object declared as "Unused import directive" when only referring to methods > - [`KT-23272`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23272) Git commit not working > - [`KT-23407`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23407) Pasting callable reference from different package suggests imports, but inserts incompilable FQN > - [`KT-23456`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23456) UAST: Enum constant constructor call arguments missing from Kotlin enums > - [`KT-23942`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23942) Fix building light-classes for MPP project containing multi-file facades > - [`KT-24072`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24072) Kotlin SDK appears as many times as there are modules in the project > - [`KT-24412`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24412) Kotlin create project wizard: Kotlin/JS no SDK > - [`KT-24933`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24933) please remove usages of com.intellij.psi.search.searches.DirectClassInheritorsSearch#search(com.intellij.psi.PsiClass, com.intellij.psi.search.SearchScope, boolean, boolean) deprecated long ago > - [`KT-24943`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24943) Project leak via LibraryEffectiveKindProviderImpl > - [`KT-24979`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24979) IndexNotReadyException in KtLightClassForSourceDeclaration#isInheritor > - [`KT-24958`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24958) Escaping goes insane when editing interpolated string in injected fragment editor > - [`KT-25024`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25024) Wrong resolve scope while resolving java.lang.String PsiClassReferenceType > ... (truncated)
Commits - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/commits)

title: build(deps): bump rxandroid from 2.0.2 to 2.1.0
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [rxandroid](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid) from 2.0.2 to 2.1.0.
Release notes *Sourced from [rxandroid's releases](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/releases).* > ## 2.1.0 > **API Enhancements** > > * [Pull 416](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/pull/416) - Add an option to post async messages > > > Download: > > ``` groovy > implementation 'io.reactivex.rxjava2:rxandroid:2.1.0' > ```
Changelog *Sourced from [rxandroid's changelog](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/blob/2.x/CHANGES.md).* > ### Version 2.1.0 - August 16, 2018 ### > > **API Enhancements** > > * [Pull 416](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/pull/416) - Add an option to post async messages
Commits - [`0efa444`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/0efa44442c2bcfe4e37290ef0d743046fa2fc985) Prepare version 2.1.0 - [`a78a85e`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/a78a85ec6e2675db8a41f325df9a073a44312903) Merge pull request [#437](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/issues/437) from shaishavgandhi05/sg/update-dependencies - [`908e6ed`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/908e6ed745ce24e8328774bb113e497ac86be169) Update gradle version - [`9afb1dc`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/9afb1dcfc9d9efce7367e219c9f80ff97cbdf029) Upgrade dependencies - [`9f81070`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/9f810700753eefcc8c55f0b52fb8ec0c188e6a9d) Update dependencies ([#435](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/issues/435)) - [`191a758`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/191a758fcce4e4d16ad0438ad4dac3fd01b4362f) Add an option to post async messages - [`e09c2d7`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/e09c2d7e6236abfc14195823e62aa0276653b38d) Merge pull request [#425](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/issues/425) from ReactiveX/race - [`c4ef6b0`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/c4ef6b0acc6d8fedbf90a06bcdc7112d59442bc3) Remove handler callbacks before setting disposed. - [`5cb2391`](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/commit/5cb239130dceab95797b7313b19f2d8e95407d8f) Prepare next development version. - See full diff in [compare view](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxAndroid/compare/2.0.2...2.1.0)

title: An issue with Picasso and vector graphics and profile placeholder drawing with API < 20
body:
On my Nexus 7 Kitkat 4.4.2 , API 19 it is crashing on drawing the profile placeholder
``` 
                         Picasso.get()
                        .load(it.avatarUrl)
                        .placeholder(R.drawable.ic_person_black_24dp)
                        .transform(CircleTransform())
                        .into(rootView.avatar)
```
Working on it

title: build(deps): bump mockk from 1.8.5 to 1.8.6
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:

body:
Sorry, if I did it not correctly; doing it first time; please, let me know what was wrong.

When extended from Application the app failed to open both on emulator with KitKat 4.4.2 (API 19) and on my physical device. As I replaced Application with MultiDexApplication it started opening OK.

build(deps): bump kotlin_version from 1.2.51 to 1.2.60
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps `kotlin_version` from 1.2.51 to 1.2.60. Updates `kotlin-gradle-plugin` from 1.2.51 to 1.2.60
Release notes *Sourced from [kotlin-gradle-plugin's releases](https://github.com/JetBrains/kotlin/releases).* > ## Kotlin 1.2.60 > ## 1.2.60 > > ### Compiler > > - [`KT-13762`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-13762) Prohibit annotations with target 'EXPRESSION' and retention 'BINARY' or 'RUNTIME' > - [`KT-18882`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-18882) Allow code to have platform specific annotations when compiled for different platforms > - [`KT-20356`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20356) Internal compiler error - This method shouldn't be invoked for INVISIBLE_FAKE visibility > - [`KT-22517`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-22517) Deprecate smartcasts for local delegated properties > - [`KT-23153`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23153) Compiler allows to set non constant value as annotation parameter > - [`KT-23413`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23413) IndexOutOfBoundsException on local delegated properties from `provideDelegate` if there's at least one non-local delegated property > - [`KT-23742`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23742) Optimise inline class redundant boxing on return from inlined lambda > - [`KT-24513`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24513) High memory usage in Kotlin and 2018.1 > - [`KT-24617`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24617) Optional expected annotation is unresolved in a dependent platform module > - [`KT-24679`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24679) KotlinUCallExpression doesn't resolve callee if it is an inline method > - [`KT-24808`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24808) NI: nested `withContext` call is reported with `Suspension functions can be called only within coroutine body` error > - [`KT-24825`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24825) NoClassDefFoundError on SAM adapter in a nested call in inlined lambda since 1.2.40 > - [`KT-24859`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24859) Disallow calls of functions annotated with receiver annotated with [**RestrictsSuspension**](https://github.com/RestrictsSuspension) in foreign suspension context > - [`KT-24911`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24911) Kotlin 1.2.50: UI for [**RecentlyNonNull**](https://github.com/RecentlyNonNull) looks strange in the editor > - [`KT-25333`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25333) Restrict visibility of Java static members from supertypes of companion object > > ### IDE > > #### Performance Improvements > > - [`KT-20924`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20924) Slow KtLightAbstractAnnotation.getClsDelegate() lightAnnotations.kt > - [`KT-23844`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23844) Kotlin property accessor searcher consumes CPU when invoked on a scope consisting only of Java files > > #### Fixes > > - [`KT-4311`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-4311) "Override members" works wrong when function is extension > - [`KT-13948`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-13948) IDE plugins: improve description > - [`KT-15300`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-15300) "INFO - project.TargetPlatformDetector - Using default platform" flood in log > - [`KT-17350`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-17350) Implement members from interface fails when one of the generic types is unresolved > - [`KT-17668`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-17668) Edit Configuration dialog doesn't have a button for choosing the "Main class" field > - [`KT-19102`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-19102) Wrong equals() and hashCode() code generated for arrays of arrays > - [`KT-20056`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-20056) TCE on creating object of an anonymous class in Kotlin script > - [`KT-21863`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-21863) Imported typealias to object declared as "Unused import directive" when only referring to methods > - [`KT-23272`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23272) Git commit not working > - [`KT-23407`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23407) Pasting callable reference from different package suggests imports, but inserts incompilable FQN > - [`KT-23456`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23456) UAST: Enum constant constructor call arguments missing from Kotlin enums > - [`KT-23942`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-23942) Fix building light-classes for MPP project containing multi-file facades > - [`KT-24072`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24072) Kotlin SDK appears as many times as there are modules in the project > - [`KT-24412`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24412) Kotlin create project wizard: Kotlin/JS no SDK > - [`KT-24933`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24933) please remove usages of com.intellij.psi.search.searches.DirectClassInheritorsSearch#search(com.intellij.psi.PsiClass, com.intellij.psi.search.SearchScope, boolean, boolean) deprecated long ago > - [`KT-24943`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24943) Project leak via LibraryEffectiveKindProviderImpl > - [`KT-24979`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24979) IndexNotReadyException in KtLightClassForSourceDeclaration#isInheritor > - [`KT-24958`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-24958) Escaping goes insane when editing interpolated string in injected fragment editor > - [`KT-25024`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25024) Wrong resolve scope while resolving java.lang.String PsiClassReferenceType > - [`KT-25092`](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-25092) SourcePsi should be physical leaf element but got OPERATION_REFERENCE > ... (truncated)

build(deps): bump rxjava from 2.1.17 to 2.2.0
label: [Label(name="dependencies")]
body:
Bumps [rxjava](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava) from 2.1.17 to 2.2.0.
Release notes *Sourced from [rxjava's releases](https://github.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/releases).* > ## 2.2.0 > [Maven](http://search.maven.org/#artifactdetails%7Cio.reactivex.rxjava2%7Crxjava%7C2.2.0%7C) > > #### Summary > > Version 2.2.0 is the next minor release of the 2.x era and contains the standardization of many experimental API additions from the past year since version 2.1.0. Therefore, the following components are now considered stable and will be supported throughout the rest of the life of RxJava 2.x. > > **Classes, Enums, Annotations** > > - **Annotation**: N/A > - **Subject**: `MulticastProcessor` > - **Classes**: `ParallelFlowable`, `UndeliverableException`, `OnErrorNotImplementedException` > - **Enum**: `ParallelFailureHandling` > - **Interfaces**: `{Completable|Single|Maybe|Observable|Flowable|Parallel}Emitter`, `{Completable|Single|Maybe|Observable|Flowable|Parallel}Converter`, `LambdaConsumerIntrospection`, `ScheduledRunnableIntrospection` > > **Operators** > > - **`Flowable`**: `as`, `concatMap{Single|Maybe|Completable}`, `limit`, `parallel`, `switchMap{Single|Maybe|Completable}`, `throttleLatest` > - **`Observable`**: `as`, `concatMap{Single|Maybe|Completable}`, `switchMap{Single|Maybe|Completable}`, `throttleLatest` > - **`Single`**: `as`, `mergeDelayError`, `onTerminateDetach`, `unsubscribeOn` > - **`Maybe`**: `as`, `mergeDelayError`, `switchIfEmpty` > - **`Completable`**: `as`, `fromMaybe`, `onTerminateDetach`, `takeUntil` > - **`ParallelFlowable`**: `as`, `map|filter|doOnNext(errorHandling)`˙, `sequentialDelayError` > - **`Connectable{Flowable, Observable}`**: `refCount(count + timeout)` > - **`Subject`/`FlowableProcessor`**: `offer`, `cleanupBuffer`, `create(..., delayError)` > - **`Test{Observer, Subscriber}`**: `assertValueAt`, `assertValuesOnly`, `assertValueSetOnly` > > *(For the complete list and details on the promotions, see [PR 6105](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/pull/6105).)* > > Release 2.2.0 is functionally identical to 2.1.17. Also to clarify, just like with previous minor version increments with RxJava, there won't be any further development or updates on the version 2.1.x (patch) level. > > ##### Other promotions > > All Experimental/Beta APIs introduced up to version 2.1.17 are now standard with 2.2. > > #### Project statistics > > - Unique contributors: **75** > - Issues closed: [**283**](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/ReactiveX/RxJava/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+created%3A2017-04-29..2018-07-31+label%3A2.x+) > -
